iot.title: Real-Time IoT Imaging with Deep Neural Networks
iot.author: Nicolas Modrzyk
iot.description: An in-depth study of applying deep neural networks for real-time image processing and analysis in Internet of Things (IoT) systems.

iot.title: Applied Learning Algorithms for Intelligent IoT
iot.author: Pethuru Raj Chelliah, Usha Sakthivel, Susila Nagarajan
iot.description: A comprehensive guide exploring how intelligent algorithms enhance data processing, decision-making, and automation in modern Internet of Things (IoT) applications.

iot.title: IoT Sensor-Based Activity Recognition
iot.author: Md Atiqur Rahman Ahad, Anindya Das Antar, Masud Ahmed
iot.description: A detailed exploration of using IoT sensor data and machine learning techniques to recognize and analyze human activities in real time.

iot.title: Beginning Azure IoT Edge Computing
iot.author: David Jensen
iot.description:
About the Book This book demystifies edge computing by guiding developers through the Azure IoT Edge platform with practical, hands-on exercises to build and deploy intelligent solutions. It helps architects determine when to leverage the edge versus the cloud, covering essential patterns, container usage, and secure device provisioning. By the end, readers will understand how to extend cloud intelligence to edge devices effectively and securely.

Chapters List

Do I Need an Intelligent Edge?

Azure IoT Edge Core Concepts

Azure IoT Edge Development Environment

Hello Edge

Developing and Debugging Edge Modules

Analytics on the Edge

Device Provisioning Service

Azure IoT Edge Security

Azure DevOps for IoT Edge Solutions

iot.title: IoT Information Processing in an Increasingly Connected World
iot.author: Leon Strous and Vinton G.1 Cerf2
iot.description:
This volume presents a comprehensive cross-domain perspective on IoT, addressing the technical challenges of architecture, interoperability, and data processing in a hyper-connected global network. It bridges the gap between hardware implementation and societal impact, exploring how vast amounts of data are securely managed and utilized across diverse industries. The text is essential for understanding the standardization efforts, security frameworks, and software middleware required to support the next generation of IoT ecosystems.

Chapters (Key Sections)

Hardware, Networks, and Data: Exploring the physical layer and connectivity standards.

Software: Middleware, platforms, and architectural patterns.

Context and Situation Awareness: How IoT systems perceive and react to environments.

Privacy and Security: Trust models, encryption, and data protection.

User-Centric IoT: Human-computer interaction and usability in smart systems.

IoT Applications: Real-world case studies in healthcare, cities, and industry.

iot.title: Machine Learning, Big Data, and IoT for Medical Informatics
iot.author: Dr. Pardeep Kumar ,Dr. Yugal Kumar ,Dr. Mohammad A. Tawhid
iot.description:
This reference work explores the convergence of machine learning, big data analytics, and the Internet of Things to revolutionize modern healthcare systems and patient monitoring. It provides a comprehensive framework for processing the massive influx of medical data from wearable devices, focusing on real-time decision-making and predictive diagnostics. The text also addresses critical challenges such as data security, privacy protocols, and the deployment of intelligent algorithms in cloud-based medical environments.

Chapters List

Introduction to Internet of Things (IoT) in Healthcare

Big Data Analytics for Intelligent Healthcare Management

Machine Learning Algorithms for Medical Informatics

Deep Learning for Medical Image Analysis

Security and Privacy Issues in IoT-based Healthcare

Cloud and Fog Computing for Medical Data Processing

Wearable Sensors and Devices for Patient Monitoring

Blockchain Technology for Electronic Health Records

Predictive Analytics for Disease Diagnosis

Case Studies in Smart Healthcare Systems

iot.title: The 5G operator
Next Generation Internet of Things 2021-2027
Build Your Own IoT Platform
iot.author: Anand Tamboli
iot.description:
This practical guide empowers developers to design and construct a custom Internet of Things platform from the ground up, bypassing costly commercial alternatives. It walks through the end-to-end architecture, from device connectivity and protocol selection to data storage and real-time visualization. Readers gain the technical know-how to integrate open-source tools into a scalable, secure, and fully controllable IoT ecosystem.

Chapters List

Introduction to IoT

IoT Strategy

The IoT Platform

Connectivity

Device Management

Data Management

Analytics

User Interface

External Systems Integration

Security

IoT Project Execution

iot.title: IoT 2.0 and the INTERNET of TRANSFORMATION (Web of Things and Digital Twins)
iot.author: Stefano Nativi, Alexander Kotsev
iot.description:
This report investigates the maturity and evolution of the Internet of Things (IoT) into "IoT 2.0," emphasizing its role as a key engine for digital transformation.
It explores the shift from simple connectivity to intelligent, interoperable systems driven by the Web of Things (WoT) and Digital Twins. The text analyzes global data sources, including patents and scientific publications, to identify emerging trends, technical challenges, and the socio-economic impact of this technological convergence.   

Chapters (Key Sections)

Introduction and Methodology

IoT Reference Framework   

IoT (Communications) Protocols: Gateways Implementations

Security Aspects

IoT Platforms and Ecosystems

Convergence Time: Addressing Interoperability Challenges (OCF, OneM2M, Mozilla IoT)

The W3C Web of Things (WoT) Initiative

IoT 2.0, Digital Age, Local Data Ecosystems, and the Internet of Transformation

IoT Landscape Analysis (Industry 4.0, Smart Home, Wearables)

Analysis of IoT Uptake: Emerging Trends

iot.title: IoT Signals-Microsoft
Internet of Things Landscape
iot.author: cube LABS
iot.description:
This report provides a comprehensive overview of the Internet of Things (IoT) landscape, exploring its transformative impact across healthcare, manufacturing, agriculture, and retail industries in the wake of COVID-19. [cite_start]It analyzes key trends like 5G adoption and edge computing while offering strategic guidance on developing secure, scalable IoT solutions to drive digital transformation. [cite_start]The text serves as a practical guide for business leaders to navigate adoption challenges, from overcoming organizational inertia to implementing robust security frameworks.   

Chapters List

The COVID-19 Impact and Future

Transforming Businesses with IoT (Overcoming Inertia)

Developing IoT Solutions (From Problem Statement to LiveOps)

The IoT Universe (History and Market Statistics)

Inside the Internet of Things (Technology, Protocols, and Architecture)

Impact Across Industries: Healthcare

Impact Across Industries: Manufacturing (IIoT)

Impact Across Industries: Agriculture

Impact Across Industries: Retail

IoT Security (Risks and Best Practices)

iot.title: Multimedia Big Data Computing for IoT Applications
iot.author: Sudeep Tanwar, Sudhanshu Tyagi, and Neeraj Kumar
iot.description: This book serves as a "how-to" guide that addresses the practical, methodological, and moral questions related to handling the massive amounts of multimedia big data (MMBD) generated by IoT devices. It examines the unique nature and complexity of MMBD computing, covering research challenges such as scalability, accessibility, reliability, heterogeneity, and Quality of Service (QoS). The text is divided into four parts focusing on technological development, multimedia big data analytics, societal impacts, and application environments.

iot.title: IoT Development for ESP32 and ESP8266 with JavaScript
iot.author: Peter Hoddie and Lizzie Prader
iot.description:
This book is a hands-on guide to building sophisticated IoT products on low-cost hardware like the ESP32 and ESP8266 using modern JavaScript. It serves as a bridge for developers, introducing embedded C/C++ programmers to JavaScript and web developers to the constraints of embedded systems. The text covers the Moddable SDK and the XS JavaScript engine, teaching readers how to handle networking, Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), data storage, hardware sensors, audio, and rich graphical user interfaces on microcontrollers.
Chapter 1: Getting Started

Chapter 2: JavaScript for Embedded C and C++ Programmers

Chapter 3: Networking

Chapter 4: Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE)

Chapter 5: Files and Data

Chapter 6: Hardware

Chapter 7: Audio

Chapter 8: Graphics Fundamentals

Chapter 9: Drawing Graphics with Poco

Chapter 10: Building User Interfaces with Piu

Chapter 11: Adding Native Code

iot.title: Raspberry Pi IoT Projects
iot.author: John C. Shovic ,Danilo Bargen
iot.description: Raspberry Pi IoT Projects is a practical, hands-on guide that demonstrates how to build real-world Internet of Things (IoT) applications using the Raspberry Pi. The book focuses on integrating sensors, cloud services, data visualization, and communication protocols to create scalable and functional IoT systems. It emphasizes project-based learning, making it suitable for students, hobbyists, and engineers who want to move from basic Raspberry Pi knowledge to complete IoT solutions

iot.title: Industrial IoT: Challenges, Design Principles, Applications, and Security
iot.author: Ismail Butun
iot.description:
Industrial IoT: Challenges, Design Principles, Applications, and Security provides a comprehensive overview of Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) systems, focusing on both theoretical foundations and real-world industrial applications. The book covers architectural design principles, communication technologies, data management, and security challenges specific to industrial environments. It brings together contributions from multiple experts, making it a valuable reference for researchers, graduate students, and engineers working in smart manufacturing, automation, and cyber-physical systems.
Introduction to Industrial IoT – ~24 pages

IIoT Architectures and Design Principles – ~28 pages

Communication Technologies for Industrial IoT – ~32 pages

Edge and Cloud Computing in IIoT – ~26 pages

Data Analytics and Machine Learning for IIoT – ~30 pages

Industrial IoT Applications and Use Cases – ~34 pages

Security and Privacy Challenges in IIoT – ~36 pages

Blockchain and Trust Management in IIoT – ~24 pages

Future Trends and Research Directions – ~20 pages

iot.title: Leveraging Industrial IoT and advanced technologies for digital transformation
iot.author: Andreas Behrendt  Enno de Boer  Tarek Kasah  Bodo Koerber  Niko Mohr  Gérard Richter
iot.description:
This book explores how Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) and advanced digital technologies can be systematically leveraged to drive large-scale digital transformation in industrial enterprises. Rather than focusing solely on technology, the authors emphasize the alignment of business strategy, organizational structure, and technological capabilities to achieve sustainable value creation. Drawing on real industrial case studies, the book provides practical frameworks, operating models, and governance principles that help organizations move from isolated pilot projects to scalable, enterprise-wide digital solutions
Introduction to Industrial IoT–Driven Digital Transformation

The Business Value of Industrial IoT

Aligning Business Strategy with Digital Capabilities

Organizational Change and Operating Models

IIoT Architecture and Technology Foundations

Advanced Technologies Enabling IIoT

Scaling Digital Solutions Across the Enterprise

Cybersecurity and Risk Management in IIoT

Case Studies from Industrial Leaders

Roadmap for Capturing Value at Scale

iot.title: Smart Technologies for Energy and Environmental Sustainability
iot.author: Parul Agarwal  Mamta Mittal  Jawed Ahmed  Sheikh Mohammad Idrees
iot.description:
Smart Technologies for Energy and Environmental Sustainability explores the role of intelligent and emerging technologies in addressing modern energy challenges and environmental sustainability. The book presents interdisciplinary research covering smart grids, renewable energy systems, energy-efficient computing, environmental monitoring, and sustainable development. By combining theoretical frameworks with practical case studies, it provides valuable insights for researchers, graduate students, and professionals working in energy systems, environmental engineering, and smart infrastructure.
Introduction to Smart Energy and Environmental Sustainability

Smart Grid Technologies and Applications

Renewable Energy Integration and Management

Internet of Things for Energy Monitoring

Machine Learning and AI in Sustainable Energy Systems

Smart Cities and Sustainable Infrastructure

iot.title: IoT and IoE Driven Smart Cities
iot.author: Samarendra Nath Sur, Valentina Emilia Balas, Akash Kumar Bhoi, Anand Nayyar
iot.description:
This book provides a detailed technical exploration of applying the Internet of Things (IoT) and the Internet of Everything (IoE) within smart city environments. It focuses heavily on the design aspects related to physical and network layer models.

The text explores utilizing advanced communication technologies—such as Multi-Input Multi-Output (MIMO), Narrow-Band IoT (NB-IoT), Ultra-Reliable Low Latency Communications (URLLC), Enhanced Mobile Broadband (eMBB), and Massive Machine-Type Communications (mMTC)—to successfully implement IoT and IoE infrastructures. It also addresses the role of cloud computing and analyzes challenges and future predictions for smart city development.
Chapter 1: A Comprehensive Review on Physical Layer Design for Smart Cities

Chapter 2: An Overview of Security and Privacy in Smart Cities

Chapter 3: Design of Multiple Access Network by Enabling User Grouping and Energy Harvesting in Relaying System for Smart Cities

Additional Key Topics Covered:

Smart Sensors and Actuators for IoE-based Smart Cities

Machine Learning and Deep Learning Algorithms for Smart Cities

Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) and Traffic Management

Energy Harvesting (EH) and Cooperative Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access (NOMA)

Cloud Computing advancements for IoT/IoE support

iot.title: The Internet of Things: Catching up to an accelerating opportunity
iot.author: McKinsey Global Institute (Michael Chui, Mark Collins, Mark Patel)
iot.description:
This influential industry report serves as a major update to McKinsey's 2015 analysis (The Internet of Things: Mapping the Value Beyond the Hype). It evaluates how the IoT market has evolved compared to initial predictions and provides a forecasted economic outlook through 2030.

The central thesis is that while IoT growth was initially slower than predicted due to "headwinds" (such as installation costs, cybersecurity issues, and change management), the potential economic value remains massive. The report estimates that by 2030, IoT could enable $5.5 trillion to $12.6 trillion in value globally. It breaks down this opportunity across specific physical settings (like factories, cities, and homes) and advises business leaders on how to scale their IoT pilots into full deployments.
Introduction: Review of the 2015 predictions vs. the 2020 reality.

The Nine Settings (Analysis by Environment):

Factory: Operations management and predictive maintenance (The largest value pool).

Human Health: Monitoring and managing illness (e.g., glucose monitoring, heart trackers).

Home: Home automation and security.

City: Public health, traffic control, and resource management.

Retail: Checkout automation and inventory optimization.

Outside: Logistics routing and autonomous vehicles.

Worksites: Operations management in mining, construction, etc.

Vehicles: Condition-based maintenance and usage-based insurance.

Offices: Energy management and security.

iot.title: IoT Signals Manufacturing Spotlight
iot.author: Microsoft, Intel
iot.description:
This report, a collaboration between Microsoft, Intel, and IoT Analytics, examines the current and future state of IoT technology in the manufacturing industry. It focuses on how manufacturers are leveraging Smart Factory operations and Smart Products to drive digital transformation.

The insights are based on a survey of 500 decision-makers in discrete, hybrid, and process manufacturing across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. [cite_start]The report highlights key trends such as the acceleration of digital transformation post-COVID-19, the shift of investments toward industrial automation, and the rising importance of sustainability and workforce enablement.

iot.title: Blockchain  Principles and Applications in IoT
iot.author: Rajdeep Chakraborty, Anupam Ghosh, Valentina Emilia Balas, Ahmed A. Elngar
iot.description:
This book is a comprehensive guide to Blockchain technology and its integration with the Internet of Things (IoT). It is designed as a resource for graduates, researchers, and professionals in computer science and IT.

The text covers the fundamental principles of blockchain, tracing its history from cryptocurrencies to broader industrial applications. It focuses on how blockchain can serve as a secure, decentralized data repository for IoT devices, addressing critical challenges like scalability, security, and privacy. The book also goes beyond financial use cases to explore applications in healthcare, supply chain management, and smart cities.

Chapters & Topics
The book is organized into three main sections:

The Study of Consensus Algorithms in Blockchain

iot.title: internet of Things and the Law
iot.author: Guido Noto La Diega
iot.description: The book presents a comprehensive analysis of the legal issues surrounding the Internet of Things (IoT). It explores the shift from dematerialisation (digital/intangible wealth) back to "rematerialisation" (the return of data and power to the physical world). The central question addressed is whether the law can steer this development in a human-centric and socially just direction. [cite_start]It analyzes how existing laws—such as privacy, intellectual property, telecommunications, and competition laws—can empower IoT end-users, while also proposing a "utopian horizon" for IoT governance based on political economy and social theory.

iot.title: TinyML Cookbook
iot.author: Gian Marco Iodice
iot.description:
his book serves as a practical guide to TinyML, a field combining machine learning with ultra-low-power embedded devices. It is structured as a cookbook with "recipes" for building end-to-end applications on the Arduino Nano 33 BLE Sense and Raspberry Pi Pico. [cite_start]The book covers a range of projects from basic prototyping to advanced use cases like voice control, gesture recognition, and image classification, and introduces concepts like microNPU (Neural Processing Unit) for next-generation edge computing.

Chapter 2: Prototyping with Microcontrollers

programming.title: Blockchain and Crypto Currency
programming.author: Makoto Yano, Chris Dai, Kenichi Masuda, Yoshio Kishimoto
programming.description:
This open-access book explores how blockchain technology can create a "high quality" marketplace for data, treating data as a new production factor similar to capital or labor. It applies economic theory to the technical architecture of blockchain, proposing ways to ensure data reliability, security, and proper valuation in a decentralized ecosystem. The text bridges the gap between engineering and economics, discussing how to prevent data monopolies while enabling secure IoT and big data applications.

Creation of Blockchain and a New Ecosystem

Market Quality Approach to IoT Data on Blockchain Big Data

Industrial Applications of Blockchain to IoT Data

Theory of Money: From Ancient Japanese Copper Coins to Virtual Currencies

DEX: A DApp for the Decentralized Marketplace

Blockchain Business and Its Regulation

Bitcoin and Blockchain Technology

ai.title: AI-Enabled Threat Detection and Security Analysis for Industrial IoT
ai.author: Hadis Karimipour ,Farnaz Derakhshan
ai.description:
AI-Enabled Threat Detection and Security Analysis for Industrial IoT focuses on the application of artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques to enhance security in Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) environments. The book addresses modern cyber threats targeting industrial systems and presents intelligent methods for intrusion detection, anomaly detection, malware analysis, and risk mitigation. It combines theoretical foundations with practical industrial use cases, making it a valuable reference for researchers, cybersecurity professionals, and engineers working with smart manufacturing and critical infrastructure systems.
Introduction to Industrial IoT Security

Threat Landscape in Industrial IoT Systems

AI and Machine Learning Fundamentals for Cybersecurity

Intrusion Detection Systems for IIoT

Anomaly Detection Using Deep Learning

Malware Detection and Classification in IIoT

Network Traffic Analysis for Industrial Systems

Secure Architectures for AI-Enabled IIoT

Case Studies in Industrial Cybersecurity

Future Directions in AI-Based IIoT Security

ai.title: Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain and IoT for Smart Healthcare
ai.author: Hitesh Kumar Sharma, Anuj Kumar, Sangeeta Pant, Mangey Ram
ai.description:
This book presents a cross-disciplinary perspective on how Artificial Intelligence (AI), the Internet of Things (IoT), and Blockchain are converging to transform traditional healthcare into a smart, remote-accessible system.

It is heavily motivated by the shift in healthcare delivery seen during the COVID-19 pandemic, focusing on telemedicine and e-healthcare. The text explains how IoT sensors collect patient data, AI analyzes it for diagnosis, and Blockchain ensures the security and privacy of that sensitive medical information (Electronic Health Records). It is designed to be accessible to both beginners and advanced researchers, bridging the gap between medical staff and technology professionals
ntroduction to Smart Healthcare and Telemedicine Systems: Overview of the shift from traditional to smart healthcare and the challenges involved.

Advanced Technologies Involved in Smart Healthcare and Telemedicine Systems: A look at the specific tech stack driving the industry.

Role of Artificial Intelligence, IoT and Blockchain in Smart Healthcare: How these three pillars interact within a single ecosystem.

Application of Artificial Intelligence in Smart Healthcare: Use cases for AI in diagnosis and patient management.

Application of IoT in Smart Healthcare: Focus on sensors, wearables, and remote monitoring tools.

Application of Blockchain in Smart Healthcare: Securing transactions and patient data ledgers.

Security and Privacy Challenge in Smart Healthcare and Telemedicine Systems: Addressing user authentication and data breaches.

Electronic Healthcare Record (EHR) Storage using Blockchain for Smart Healthcare: A specific framework for managing digital health records securely.
